intro: Zahlbrucknera oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Zahlbrucknera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes many desert and arid environment plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
